asset.name: neladalkib
asset.one_liner: Best-in-class ALK inhibitor with TRK-sparing selectivity designed to overcome lorlatinib resistance

target.name: ALK
target.pathway: ALK fusion (EML4-ALK) → constitutive kinase activation → tumor growth

biology.simple_explanation: ALK is a receptor tyrosine kinase that when fused to partner genes like EML4 creates oncogenic fusion proteins driving tumor growth. ALK fusions occur in 3-5% of NSCLC, typically in younger patients with significant impact on quality of life.
biology.patient_demographics: Often younger patients; significant impact on quality of life
biology.cns_involvement: 30-40% present with brain metastases; ~50% develop brain mets over disease course

resistance_mutations.primary_mutation: G1202R (most common resistance mutation to 2nd-gen ALK TKIs)
resistance_mutations.compound_mutations: Increasingly common after lorlatinib; single agent often insufficient

why_good_target.clinical_validation: Multiple approved ALK TKIs with excellent outcomes in 1L (lorlatinib mPFS not reached at 60 months)
unmet_need: 60% of patients progress on 2L lorlatinib within 24 months
Compound mutations emerge after lorlatinib with limited treatment options
TRK-related toxicity with current ALK TKIs

lead.name: ALK+ NSCLC (TKI pre-treated)
lead.rationale: High unmet need in patients progressing on lorlatinib and other ALK TKIs

expansion.name: ALK+ NSCLC (TKI-naïve)
expansion.rationale: Potential to compete with lorlatinib in frontline setting

expansion.name: ALK+ solid tumors (non-NSCLC)
expansion.rationale: ALK fusions in IMT, neuroblastoma, and other cancers

tki_pretreated_pivotal.description: ALK+ NSCLC with ≥1 prior ALK TKI, data cutoff Aug 29, 2025

alk_solid_tumor_results.tumor_types: IMT, neuroblastoma, sarcoma, peritoneal mesothelioma, RCC, CRC

safety.key_differentiator: TRK-sparing design (>20x selectivity ALK vs TRKB)

ongoing_trials.design: Head-to-head vs alectinib in TKI-naïve ALK+ NSCLC

trk_sparing.clinical_relevance: Avoids CNS toxicity (cognitive effects, mood changes) seen with lorlatinib

mutation_coverage.compound_mutations: Active against compound mutations that confer lorlatinib resistance

cns_penetration.clinical_evidence: 32-63% intracranial ORR depending on prior therapy

catalysts.what_to_watch: Enrollment pace for 1L head-to-head vs alectinib

approved_alk_tkis.position: Current 1L standard; mPFS not reached at 60 months
approved_alk_tkis.limitation: Compound mutations emerge; CNS toxicity (cognitive effects 21%)
Inferior to lorlatinib in 1L; limited mutation coverage
Inferior to lorlatinib; limited compound mutation activity

neladalkib_advantages: Active against lorlatinib-resistant compound mutations (58% ORR)
Strong CNS activity comparable to lorlatinib
Only option for post-lorlatinib patients with compound mutations

investment_analysis.probability_of_success: High for accelerated approval in TKI pre-treated
key_risks: Lorlatinib's dominant 1L position (mPFS not reached at 60 mo)
Transaminase elevations may limit some patients

market_opportunity.key_insight: Larger market than ROS1 with higher peak sales potential
